metadata.title: CVE-2020-13253 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
sd_wp_addr in hw/sd/sd.c in QEMU 4.2.0 uses an unvalidated address, whichleads to an out-of-bounds read during sdhci_write() operations. A guest OSuser can crash the QEMU process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.31').
